arm_group.description: Patients who are randomly assigned to receive the LMA-Supreme
Patients who are randomly assigned to receive endotracheal intubation

brief_summary.textblock:
We hypothesise that the use of the LMA-Supreme provides greater ease of insertion and
      reduced haemodynamic variability during insertion compared to the tracheal tube, whilst
      still maintaining a patent airway to facilitate elective laparoscopic cholecystectomy in
      selected patients.

clinical_study.brief_title: Laryngeal Mask Airway Supreme Versus the Tracheal Tube as an Airway Device in Elective Laparoscopic Cholecystectomy

detailed_description.textblock:
The Laryngeal Mask Airway Supreme(LMA-S) has been used successfully to maintain a patent
      airway for laparoscopic surgery. Our study compares the use of LMA-S with that of the
      tracheal tube (ETT) with respect to the ease of insertion and potential haemodynamic
      disturbance during insertion.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  American Society of Anesthesiologists (ASA) Physical Status 1 and 2

          -  Undergoing elective laparoscopic cholecystectomy

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  BMI > 30

          -  Known gastro-oesophageal reflux disease

          -  predicted or documented difficult airway

          -  contraindications to drugs in the standardized anaesthesia protocol

clinical_study.official_title: The Laryngeal Mask Airway Supreme (TM) is an Effective Alternative to Laryngoscope-guided Tracheal Intubation for Patients Undergoing Elective Laparoscopic Cholecystectomy-- A Prospective Randomized Controlled Trial

primary_outcome.description: Time to achieve effective airway was defined as time between removing the face-mask, inserting the airway device and obtaining a sustained square-wave capnograph trace with manual ventilation

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Number of attempts needed for successful placement of either the LMA-Supreme or the tracheal tube, as assigned
secondary_outcome.measure: Number of attempts taken for successful placement of airway device

secondary_outcome.description: Number of attempts needed for successful placement of gastric tube. Correct gastric tube placement was determined by positive suctioning of gastric contents or detection of injected air with epigastric auscultation.
secondary_outcome.measure: Number of attempts taken for successful placement of gastric tube

secondary_outcome.description: Systolic blood pressure and heart rate at 0 min, 1 min, 5 min, starting from the time the face mask was removed from the patient's face.
secondary_outcome.measure: Haemodynamic response to insertion of airway device

secondary_outcome.description: Peak airway pressure recorded during pneumoperitoneum, measured during the surgery
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed intra-operatively, during the period of pneumoperitoneum

secondary_outcome.description: Patients were asked about the presence of sore throat - defined as the presence of constant pain in the throat, independent of swallowing, 1 hr after the end of surgery. No further follow-up.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed 1 hr after the surgery, at the Recovery Area

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Subject)
